reviews.review_msg: I was a student of HIST 255. Honestly, I was a student of 255. I saw someone comment that Dr. Brown is an emotional professor while he is giving a lecture. I do not agree with that and I think 90% of Hist 255 students do not believe that! Also, I believe these "unbelievable" comments are from "one single person".
Fantastic
Amazing
Dr. Brown is a great professor! I highly recommend taking this class with him! He is one of the best professors in the SFU History Department!
Professor Brown is an absolute gem! His lectures were very interesting and well organized. Highly reccomend taking this class.
Good to take if you need to boost your GPA. TA is knowledgeable and nice though.
His emotions are out of control when he  is giving lectures.
One of the greatest history professors at SFU! Strongly recommend taking this class with him. Make sure to participate and do the readings! He also makes his lectures very interesting!
This Prof needs some professional help. Hope that SFU can host some emotion management and communication skill workshops for Prof. Brown.

Professor Brown is one of the best profs in the history department! His lectures were fun to listen to and very interesting. The class only had three essays and also had four in class mini assignments. Make sure to participate as it is worth 23% of your grade and do the readings before tutorial. I Strongly recommend taking this class!

Jeremy is an amazing professor! I had him in Spring 2021 for Chinese History and he was absolutely hilarious. He makes lectures really entertaining with his own personal swing on it. If you need to take a history course, he is the professor to look for!!! 10/10!

Jeremy is the GOAT by far. He really makes the lecture content interesting. All opinions are respected and he engages with the class. Honestly the most laid back lecture I have ever been in. He doesn't expect you to memorize dates. Instead he tries to get you to understand what life was like for the people living in the time period. Must take prof
I agree with many of these posts. Dr. Brown is truly a great prof! He's very approachable and gives great (and actually helpful) feedback.

Fantastic professor, very approachable in office hours and is a very fair marker. Very accommodating to the needs of students: For our last assignment we have a film screening that is threatened by a bus strike, and so hes offering to drive students in the event the strike affects us. Weekly readings are manageable. Overall A+

He's the best. His classes are fascinating, well organized and he likes to adapt to changing times. He took time out of every class to meet with us about our papers and gave us freedom for the final project. I've taken three of his classes. An absolute gem. Quite a bit of reading though.
Dr. Brown was a spectacular prof, he is inspiring and loves to teach. If you want to learn take his classes.

A true scholar and a nice person. Very caring and approachable and respect all students who work hard. However, course readings are heavy and required for discussions and pop quiz. No tolerance to students who is late for class or no prep for discussion, which will cause a huge reduction on the grade.

The class was run by the students, meaning participation and class discussion/activity based. He makes you work for your grade for sure. Encourages you to talk in class, and marks a little tough, but I am glad I got to have him as a prof. Highly recommend visiting him in office hours. He gives great ideas regarding your project and other areas.

A very good professor, love talking with students in his office hour. Hard working is very necessary. Do not skip his class until you finish all of your quiz, he will not tell you which class he will test your quiz. Please read the books he show you or you can not have a good mark.

This class is pretty interesting and I honestly don't mind the weekly journals, but it would be nice if the readings were organized more thoughtfully. Some weeks you're assigned to read less than 5 pages, other weeks be prepared to read 150+ pages.

This was BY FAR the single best university course I have ever taken.  Professor Brown is profoundly knowledgeable, passionate and  approachable. I strongly recommend attending his office hours and discussing the lectures. His lectures are incredibly organized - you will NOT have time to play games/text in class. You MUST take lots of notes.
Good professor and teacher assistance. The grading is fair for everyone either Chinese and non Chinese.
One of the best prof at SFU, if you show him you made effort, good mark guaranteed. Take classes with Jeremy.
Passionate and knowledgeable professor.  Would definitely recommend.
Excellent prof who is extremely interested and knowledgeable about what he teaches.
Wouldn't even let me hand in late work.
really talented professor, Profound knowledge, interesting lecture.
excellent prof for chinese history. he is very knowledgeable and his lectures are clear and interesting from beginning to end. don't be late for class though!

There was this one time when I was late for his lecture, and I found myself standing outside the door and spent 3 min contemplating if i should go in or not. But he's a good prof and his tas are awesome.

(Continuing)His notes list the important points (periods, people, policies, perspectives and events) instead of cover everything, which means you need to listen carefully in the lecture, especially when he slow down. Weekly assignments are very useful and , which make you won't feel nervous before exams. His quizzes and exams are (To be continued)

I took HIST254 with him this Fall Term(2012),he is brilliant professor. Thanks to his patient explanation towards history periods and clear analysis towards historical periods, I got 87 out of 100. He is very knowledgeable, insightful, minded and humorous, and and he never merely repeat what the textbook said. (To be continued)
great prof

Awesome professor but kind of intimidating... really scary if you're late or chatting in class. He memorizes the names and faces of all his students so don't think you can get away with it! Don't play on your laptops or cellphones, he can tell! Overall great professor, would take another class with him.

Lecture material and courseware readings are crucial to doing well on the exam. It's important to attend every tutorial for this very reason. You'll learn critical information you can use in your exam responses. He aims to have his students think outside the box and analyze information carefully. If you can provide insight, you'll do well.

Very knowledgable in his field of studies. Exam questions and marking are very fair. Pretty easy course if you attend his lectures. Text book isn't entirely useful, focus more on couseware. His points are very clear, and emphaises a lot on testable material. Funny, and interesting lectures. Remebers your name if you approach him. Highly recommeded!

Great prof. He really knows how to convey his material. Makes dry history interesting, and stays away from stereotypical judgements. DON'T be late to class. He hates it. He has his rules, and his way of teaching class. Which I think is completely understandable.
Took HIST 255 and taking 479. He excepts hard work from his students. No more, no less. Punctual, clear, and helpful.
OMG! tis prof is the BEST prof on campus! just dont be late though

Fantastic professor! Dr. Brown is extremely knowledgeable and passionate in his field, and is able to convey material in a combined serious/funny lecture style making it enjoyable and informative. One of the best professors I've had at SFU to date! (Both 254 and 255 are excellent courses).

If you're not serious about the topic & just want a prof that remembers your name, Brown is your man. Otherwise, avoid!  Knows nothing about early Chinese hist. Can't support his own, sometimes ridiculous, statements. Vacuous lectures, naive platitudes, high school level assignments & childish rules like docking marks if your cell rings in class.
this guy was a good prof, but he expects too much from his 400 level students. I took his 485: Cold War and busted my ass. Ended up with a B.This guy's a freak. who got an A in his class?
Fabulous course, fantastic professor. Thought this would be my only Chinese history class and discovered that it definitely won't be.
good teacher, but i hate his tutorial, lotz of reading before each tutorial

This class was fun. He's very enthusiastic about teaching the class. He loves what he's doing and is pretty funny. Participation in tutorials is 22% in total (11 sessions). If you just go and not talk for every session, the most you'll get is 11%. Midterm was 18% and was out of 18, which I found unfair. Lots of reading for the course.

I LOVED this class! I have no prior desire or interest to take any history course, let alone a Chinese history course. Prof. Brown was by far the best professor I have EVER had at SFU. He is so approchable and helpful. He takes the time to get to know everyone in the class (all 120 of them). His lectures are interactive and excitting. Great course!
Awesome teacher, just dont be late or miss any classes.

Super awesome prof. make sure you show up readings done (there not that hard, and very interesting), on time, no cell phones. He is a good speaker, and remembers everyone's names, and i mean EVERYONE's

If every professor were like Brown, I'd get straight A's not because the material is easy but because the teaching and the style of his courses are amazing. I've never been more engaged in a class. I had no interest in China prior to this class, and I still loved the course.

Wow! I LOVE this professor. He is so amazing. His office hours consist of sitting at Renaissance coffee and chatting with his students. He knows EVERYONE's name in the lecture hall (That's 102 student). His TA's are well trained, the course material is easy and very engaging. 1 complaint: wasn't a fan of his midterm of only 18 marks for 18 percent.
if you go to class and tutorial, you will be fine. Great professor forever.

Great prof and loved his lectures! He does not baby students with overly detailed power points and it's up to them to come to class.  Sometimes the TAs used a set of different criteria than Prof Brown.

I've also taken hist254 and 255 with Dr.Brown. He is a great lecturer who is passionate about his subjects. He is very clear on what he expects of students. He will try to remember everyone's name because he wants to show you the respect that he wants from you! He brings the facts and his own point of view to make lectures very interesting.

I had Prof Brown for both HIST 254 and 255. He is amazing! Very interesting lectures. Loved his classes. There is a lot of reading, but very manageable. Highly recommended even if you're not a history major such as myself.
GREAT PROF!!!
best prof ever for HIST 255- History of China since the 1800s

I actually took 254 and 255 with Dr. Brown. His lectures are very organized and to the point (very captivating, as well). He has very clear expectations (i.e. don't be late; attend lecture; do the readings), and if you follow his guidelines, it's a joyride. All in all, a very approachable and caring professor. Definitely take courses with him!
very good prof! extremely interesting and nice!! definitely take his class if you get a chance

A VERY good prof, and interesting class. Knows what he is doing and very organized! There are however a great amount of readings to do each week, but if you are able to keep up with it you will be fine!
BEST PROF EVER!!!
